definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: The Stonehenge rite was a local staple for many decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，巨石阵仪式都是当地的一项主要活动。

sentences.english: Stonehenge is perhaps the most astounding construct of pre-history still standing.
sentences.chinese: 巨石阵也许是遗存至今最令人感到神秘的史前建筑。

sentences.english: Stonehenge is one of the world's best preserved pre-historic monuments.
sentences.chinese: 巨石阵是世界上保存最好的史前遗址之一。

sentences.english: Fallen snow rests on Stonehenge in Salisbury, southern England, January 7, 2010.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰南部索尔兹伯里的巨石阵，斑斑积雪落于其中。

sentences.english: It will completely change the way we think about the landscape around Stonehenge.
sentences.chinese: 它将彻底改变我们对巨石阵周围风景的认识方法。

sentences.english: Bluestones were used which are the smaller stones in the current monument.
sentences.chinese: 所用的青石是现存的巨石阵中比较小的那些。
巨石阵肯定是个汇集点。

sentences.english: Tilburg set the new record with 110 people spitting fire simultaneously.
sentences.chinese: 此前的纪录是在英国巨石阵70人同时喷火创造。

sentences.english: Bringing a sarsen stone to Stonehenge requires years of planning.
sentences.chinese: 把岩石带到巨石阵是需要常年的计划的。

sentences.english: Some argue that megalithic complexes are astronomical observatories.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为，巨石阵乃是天文台。

sentences.english: Stonehenge is believed to be a large earthwork constructed about 5000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 巨石阵无疑是5000年前的一项巨大的土木工程。

pinyin: Suo3 er3 zi1 bo2 li3 ping2 yuan2
